comments:
Create an entity with one attribute

@Entity
public class Employee {
   private int foo;
}


copy and paste the private int foo, let the java model update and show the compiler error, then rename the second attribute.  Now if you click back to the original foo attribute you'll get this exception.  It also occurs if you choose to generate ddl, and probably for other actions.

java.lang.RuntimeException: Java Model Exception: Java Model Status [foo#2 [in Employee [in [Working copy] Employee.java [in model [in ejbModule [in FooEJB]]]]] does not exist]
at org.eclipse.dali.core.adapters.java.FieldAttribute.getTypeSignature(FieldAttribute.java:63)
at org.eclipse.dali.core.adapters.java.Attribute.isPrimitiveType(Attribute.java:153)
at org.eclipse.dali.core.adapters.java.JavaBasicMappingModelAdapter.defaultApplies(JavaBasicMappingModelAdapter.java:234)
at org.eclipse.dali.ui.views.MappingComposite.defaultConfigurationElementFor(MappingComposite.java:174)
at org.eclipse.dali.ui.views.MappingComposite.replaceDefaultMappingChoice(MappingComposite.java:265)
at org.eclipse.dali.ui.views.MappingComposite.populate(MappingComposite.java:220)
at org.eclipse.dali.ui.views.MappingComposite.populate(MappingComposite.java:211)
fixed this for attributes and methods
verified this is fixed in build R-0.5RC2-200606280020
